meanings.definition: Resembling or having the appearance of a stone.
meanings.sent1: The lithoid statue in the garden looked like a solid rock.
meanings.sent2: The path was covered in lithoid pebbles that sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The lithoid cat figurine on the shelf seemed to purr when you touched it.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt lithoid, unmoving and cold, after the betrayal.
meanings.sent5: The lithoid walls of the ancient castle stood tall against time's erosion.

meanings.definition: Having characteristics or qualities of a rock.
meanings.sent1: The lithoid terrain made hiking difficult but rewarding.
meanings.sent2: The lithoid structure of the building made it sturdy and durable.
meanings.sent3: The lithoid cookies Grandma baked were surprisingly soft and delicious.
meanings.sent4: His voice echoed off the lithoid cliffs, carrying his message far.
meanings.sent5: The lithoid armor protected the knight in battle, deflecting blows effortlessly.
